original: gang la gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang /
analyzed: gang la gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang /
translated: where there is no form, no feeling, no perception, no volitional factors, no consciousness, no eyes, no ears, no nose, no tongue, no body, no mind, no form, no sound, no smell, no taste, no texture, no mental object,

original: ro dang / reg dang / chos dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang /🔽mig gi 'dus te reg pa dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / @500a *//
analyzed: ro dang / reg dang / chos dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / @500a *//
translated: form, sound, smell, taste, texture, and mental objects; eye consciousness, ear consciousness, nose consciousness, tongue consciousness, body consciousness, and mental consciousness;🔽eye contact, ear contact, nose contact,

original: lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang /
analyzed: lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang /
translated: tongue contact, body contact, and mental contact; the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact, the feeling that arises from the condition of ear contact, the feeling that arises from the condition of nose contact,

original: lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang /
analyzed: lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang /
translated: It is the earth element, the water element, the fire element, the wind element,

original: nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang /
translated: the space element, and the consciousness element. It is ignorance, formation, consciousness, name and form, the six sense sources, contact, feeling, craving,🔽grasping, becoming, birth, and old age and death. It is the perfection of generosity, the perfection of discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence,

original: len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: and the perfection of concentration.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang /
translated: emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness,

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / @500b dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / @500b dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang /
translated: ultimate emptiness, emptiness of conditioned phenomena, emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, emptiness of the unlimited, emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, emptiness of non-dispersal,

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang /
translated: emptiness of inherent existence, emptiness of all phenomena, emptiness of intrinsic characteristics, emptiness of non-apprehension, emptiness of non-entities, and emptiness of essential nature.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang /🔽'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang /
translated: the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment,🔽the noble eightfold path, the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
translated: the emptiness gate of liberation, the signlessness gate of liberation, the wishlessness gate of liberation, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas,

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang /🔽phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams @501a *//
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams @501a *//
translated: the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, great love, great compassion, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, the result of stream-winner, the result of once-returner,

original: cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / chos de dag gi brjod pa'ang dmigs su med pa'o ////🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa /
analyzed: cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / chos de dag gi brjod pa'ang dmigs su med pa'o //// shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa /

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe chos thams cad rmi lam lta bur yongs su shes so //🔽chos thams cad sgra brnyan lta @506a *//

original: bur yongs su shes so //
analyzed: bur yongs su shes so //

original: chos thams cad sprul pa lta bur yongs su shes so //

analyzed: 'di ltar / yang dag pa ma yin pas chos thams cad ni /

translated: “When bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom like this,

analyzed: 'du byed la chags pa med do //

analyzed: skye mched rnams la chags pa med do //

analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la chags pa med do //

analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la chags pa med do //

analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la chags pa med do //

analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la chags pa med do //

translated: and they are not attached to the perfection of wisdom.🔽“They are not attached to inner emptiness,

analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid la chags pa med do //

analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid la chags pa med do // stong pa nyid stong pa @508a *//

analyzed: nyid la chags pa med do //

analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid la chags pa med do //

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid la chags pa med do //
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid la chags pa med do //
translated: they are not attached to ultimate emptiness,🔽they are not attached to the emptiness of conditioned phenomena,

analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid la chags pa med do; ;'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la chags pa med do //

analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la chags pa med do // thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la chags pa med do //

analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la chags pa med do // ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la chags pa med do //

analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la chags pa med do //

analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la chags pa med do //

analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams la chags pa med do //

analyzed: stobs rnams la chags pa med do //

analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la chags pa med do //

analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la chags pa med do //

analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams la chags pa med do //

analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams la chags pa med do //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams la chags pa med do //

analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams la chags pa med do; ;so so yang dag par rig pa rnams la chags pa med do //

analyzed: byams pa chen po la chags pa med do //
translated: there is no attachment to the six superknowledges,🔽there is no attachment to the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening,🔽there is no attachment to the ten powers of the tathāgatas,

original: snying rje chen po la chags pa med do //
analyzed: snying rje chen po la chags pa med do //

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la chags pa med do //

analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la chags pa med do //

analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la chags pa med do //

analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la chags pa med do; ;dgra bcom pa nyid la chags pa med do //
translated: there is no attachment to the state of a worthy one,

original: rang byang chub la chags pa med do //
analyzed: rang byang chub la chags pa med do //

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la chags pa med do //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la chags pa med do //

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la chags pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la chags pa med do //

analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnas shing sa dang po yongs su rdzogs par byed de /

analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags mi skyed do //

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni / 'di ltar @509a *//

analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags skyed par lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: so how could the desire realm’s desire arise for him?🔽Dwelling in this perfection of wisdom, he perfects the eighth level,

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnas shing sa brgyad pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de; de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags mi skyed do //
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnas shing sa brgyad pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de; de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags mi skyed do //
translated: and the desire realm’s desire does not arise for him.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni / 'di ltar des sa de'ang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar des sa de'ang mi dmigs na /
translated: Because he does not apprehend that level,

original: de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags skyed par lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags skyed par lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: so how could the desire realm’s desire arise for him?

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnas shing sa dgu pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnas shing sa dgu pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: Dwelling in this perfection of wisdom, he perfects the ninth level,

original: de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags mi skyed do //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags mi skyed do //
translated: and the desire realm’s desire does not arise for him.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni / 'di ltar des sa de'ang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar des sa de'ang mi dmigs na /
translated: Because they do not apprehend that level.

original: de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags skyed par lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags skyed par lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could desire and attachment to the desire realm arise there?

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnas shing sa bcu pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnas shing sa bcu pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: They stand in this perfection of wisdom and complete the tenth level.

original: de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags mi skyed do //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags mi skyed do //
translated: They do not give rise to desire and attachment to the desire realm.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni / 'di ltar des sa de'ang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar des sa de'ang mi dmigs na /
translated: Because they do not apprehend that level.

original: de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags skyed par lta ga la 'gyur /🔽de shes rab @510a *//
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags skyed par lta ga la 'gyur / de shes rab @510a *//
translated: How could desire and attachment to the desire realm arise there?

original: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de'ang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de'ang mi dmigs so //
translated: They stand in the perfection of wisdom and do not apprehend that perfection of wisdom.

original: de mi dmigs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa der chos thams cad kyang 'dus par mthong ste /
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa der chos thams cad kyang 'dus par mthong ste /
translated: When they practice the perfection of wisdom that is not apprehended, they see that all dharmas are included in that perfection of wisdom.

original: chos de dag kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: chos de dag kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: They do not apprehend those dharmas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni / 'di ltar chos de dag dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar chos de dag dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: It is thus: those dharmas and the perfection of wisdom are not two, nor are they divided.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni / 'di ltar chos de dag ni /
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar chos de dag ni /
translated: It is thus: those dharmas

original: tha dad du bya ba gang yang med de /
analyzed: tha dad du bya ba gang yang med de /
translated: are not differentiated in any way.

original: chos kyi dbyings su bstan pa dang / de bzhin nyid du bstan pa dang / yang dag pa'i mthar bstan pas chos thams cad dbyer med do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings su bstan pa dang / de bzhin nyid du bstan pa dang / yang dag pa'i mthar bstan pas chos thams cad dbyer med do //
translated: All dharmas are undifferentiated because they are taught as the dharma-element, taught as suchness, taught as the very limit of reality.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord,

original: de ltar chos thams cad dbyer ma mchis pa lags na /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad dbyer ma mchis pa lags na /
translated: if all dharmas are undifferentiated,

original: ji ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams bstan pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams bstan pa lags /
translated: how are wholesome and unwholesome dharmas taught?

original: ji ltar 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams bstan pa lags /🔽ji ltar zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa ma mchis pa'i chos rnams bstan pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams bstan pa lags / ji ltar zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa ma mchis pa'i chos rnams bstan pa lags /
translated: How are mundane and supramundane dharmas taught?🔽How are dharmas with outflows and without outflows taught?

original: ji ltar 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams bstan pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams bstan pa lags /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de la 'dus byas sam /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de la 'dus byas sam /
translated: Is the intrinsic nature of dharmas conditioned

original: 'dus @510b ma byas sam /
analyzed: 'dus @510b ma byas sam /
translated: or unconditioned?

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: Is it the fruit of entering the stream,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
translated: arhatship,

original: rang byang chub bam /
analyzed: rang byang chub bam /
translated: individual enlightenment,

original: sems gang yang brjod du yod dam /
analyzed: sems gang yang brjod du yod dam /
translated: or is it any mind at all that can be described?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni / ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni / ma lags so //
translated: it cannot.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de bas na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bas na /
translated: “Therefore, Subhūti,

original: khyod kyis rnam grangs des 'di ltar chos thams cad dbyer med pa dang / chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'byung ba med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis rnam grangs des 'di ltar chos thams cad dbyer med pa dang / chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'byung ba med par rig par bya'o //
translated: through this one of many explanations, you should know that all dharmas are indivisible, that all dharmas are without defining characteristics, are unborn, and do not arise.

original: rab 'byor / ba sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe gzugs zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ba sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe gzugs zhes bya ba'am /

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba'am /

analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba'am /

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba'am /

analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid ces bya ba'am /

analyzed: rang byang chub ces bya ba'am /

analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ces bya ba'am /

analyzed: chos gang gi rang bzhin yang mi dmigs so //
translated: or ‘the nature of any dharma.’

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
translated: Subhūti, it is because

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du
translated: “When bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, from the time when they first begin to set their mind on enlightenment until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood,

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin la mkhas par bya'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin la mkhas par bya'o //
translated: they should become skilled in the nature of all phenomena by way of nonapprehending.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin la mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin la mkhas pa ni /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings who are skilled in the nature of all phenomena

original: byang chub kyi lam yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: perfect the path to awakening,

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: mature sentient beings,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: and take hold of a buddhafield.

original: de la gnas te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams ci nas kyang dul bar gyur nas srid pa gsum na mi snang ba de ltar rnam par btul to //
analyzed: de la gnas te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams ci nas kyang dul bar gyur nas srid pa gsum na mi snang ba de ltar rnam par btul to //
translated: Having stood in that, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, they tame sentient beings in such a way that they are tamed and do not appear in the three existences.

original: rab @513a *// 'byor; de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mtshan nyid med pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rab @513a *// 'byor; de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mtshan nyid med pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should train in the perfection of wisdom in that way, by way of the absence of marks.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las /
translated: This was the sixty-second chapter, “Instruction,” of “The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines.”

original: le'u drug cu rtsa gnyis pa'o ////
analyzed: le'u drug cu rtsa gnyis pa'o ////
translated: Chapter Sixty-Three

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu /
analyzed: chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu /

original: dngos po ma mchis pa /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa /

analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa rnams la /
translated: empty of their own marks, and have the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'di dag ni /
translated: “These are the words of the Lord:

original: dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos so //

analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos so // 'di dag ni /

original: zag pa med pa'i chos so //🔽'di dag ni /

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos so //🔽'di dag ni /

analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o // 'di dag ni /

analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o // 'di dag ni /

analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o // 'di dag ni /

original: 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'di dag ni /
translated: These are the causes for

analyzed: zhes bgyi bar ji ltar rnam par dgod par 'gyur /

analyzed: 'di dag ni / zag pa med pa'i chos so //

original: 'di dag ni /🔽'dus byas kyi chos so //

translated: These are phenomena that are to be directly perceived by oneself and others.

analyzed: 'di dag ni / 'dus ma byas kyi chos so //
translated: These are phenomena that are to be directly perceived by oneself and others.🔽These are phenomena that are to be directly perceived by oneself and others.🔽These are phenomena that are to be directly perceived by oneself and others.🔽These are phenomena that are to be directly perceived by oneself and others.🔽These are phenomena that are to be directly perceived by oneself and others.🔽These are phenomena that are to be directly perceived by oneself and others.🔽These are phenomena that are to be directly perceived by oneself and others.🔽These are phenomena that are to be directly perceived by oneself and others.🔽These are phenomena that are to be directly perceived by oneself and others.🔽These are phenomena that are to be directly perceived by oneself and others.🔽These are phenomena that are to be directly perceived by oneself and others.🔽These are phenomena that are to be directly perceived by oneself and others.🔽These are phenomena that are to be directly perceived by oneself and others.🔽These are phenomena that are to be directly perceived by oneself and others.🔽These are phenomena that are to be directly perceived by oneself and others.🔽These are phenomena that are to be directly perceived by oneself and others.

original: 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'di dag ni /
translated: These are phenomena that are to be directly perceived by oneself and

analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o; ;'di dag ni /
translated: They are the causes for actualizing the fruit of stream enterer.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //🔽'di dag ni /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o // 'di dag ni /
translated: They are the causes for actualizing the fruit of once-returner.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They are the causes for actualizing the fruit of non-returner.

original: 'di dag ni; dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //🔽'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'di dag ni; dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o // 'di dag ni /

analyzed: rang byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'o // 'di dag ni /

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They are the causes for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: zhes bgyi bar ji ltar rnam par dgod par 'gyur /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: zhes bgyi bar ji ltar rnam par dgod par 'gyur / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: How can they be established?”

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa so so'i skye @514a *//🔽bo ni; rmi lam yang dmigs la /🔽rmi lam mthong ba'ang dmigs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa so so'i skye @514a *// bo ni; rmi lam yang dmigs la / rmi lam mthong ba'ang dmigs so //
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti, here, the childish, the untrained, ordinary people🔽apprehend dreams,🔽and they apprehend those who see dreams.

original: sgra brnyan yang dmigs la /
analyzed: sgra brnyan yang dmigs la /
translated: They apprehend echoes,

original: sgra brnyan nyan pa'ang dmigs so //🔽mig yor yang dmigs la /
analyzed: sgra brnyan nyan pa'ang dmigs so // mig yor yang dmigs la /
translated: He perceives the sound of an echo.🔽He perceives a mirage.

original: mig yor mthong ba'ang dmigs so //🔽sgyu ma'ang dmigs la /
analyzed: mig yor mthong ba'ang dmigs so // sgyu ma'ang dmigs la /
translated: He perceives one who sees a mirage.🔽He perceives an illusion.

original: sgyu ma mthong ba'ang dmigs so //🔽smig rgyu'ang dmigs la /🔽smig rgyu mthong ba'ang dmigs so; ;sprul pa'ang dmigs la /
analyzed: sgyu ma mthong ba'ang dmigs so // smig rgyu'ang dmigs la / smig rgyu mthong ba'ang dmigs so; ;sprul pa'ang dmigs la /
translated: He perceives one who sees an illusion.🔽He perceives a magical creation.

original: sprul pa mthong ba'ang dmigs so //🔽des rmi lam yang dmigs la /
analyzed: sprul pa mthong ba'ang dmigs so // des rmi lam yang dmigs la /
translated: He perceives one who sees a magical creation.🔽He perceives a dream.

original: rmi lam mthong ba'ang dmigs /🔽sgra brnyan yang dmigs /🔽sgra brnyan nyan pa'ang dmigs /
analyzed: rmi lam mthong ba'ang dmigs / sgra brnyan yang dmigs / sgra brnyan nyan pa'ang dmigs /
translated: He perceives one who sees a dream.🔽He perceives the sound of an echo.

original: mig yor yang dmigs /🔽mig yor mthong ba'ang dmigs /🔽sgyu ma'ang dmigs /
analyzed: mig yor yang dmigs / mig yor mthong ba'ang dmigs / sgyu ma'ang dmigs /
translated: He perceives one who hears the sound of an echo.🔽He perceives a mirage.🔽He perceives one who sees a mirage.

original: sgyu ma mthong ba'ang dmigs /🔽smig rgyu'ang dmigs /🔽smig rgyu mthong ba'ang dmigs /
analyzed: sgyu ma mthong ba'ang dmigs / smig rgyu'ang dmigs / smig rgyu mthong ba'ang dmigs /
translated: He perceives an illusion.🔽He perceives one who sees an illusion.

original: sprul pa'ang dmigs /
analyzed: sprul pa'ang dmigs /
translated: He perceives a magical creation.🔽He perceives one who sees a magical creation.

original: sprul pa mthong ba'ang dmigs nas lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis dge ba'i 'du bya ba'ang mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: sprul pa mthong ba'ang dmigs nas lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis dge ba'i 'du bya ba'ang mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: Having perceived a dream, he performs virtuous deeds with his body, speech, and mind.

original: lus dang; ngag dang / yid kyis mi dge ba'i 'du bya ba'ang mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: lus dang; ngag dang / yid kyis mi dge ba'i 'du bya ba'ang mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: They also form unwholesome formations with their body, speech, and mind.

original: de bzhin du lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang; mi g-yo ba'i 'du bya ba'ang mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang; mi g-yo ba'i 'du bya ba'ang mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: Similarly, they also form meritorious, unmeritorious, and unshakable formations with their body, speech, and mind.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: mtha' las @514b 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang stong pa nyid gnyis la gnas shing sems can rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: mtha' las @514b 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang stong pa nyid gnyis la gnas shing sems can rnams la chos ston te /
translated: dwelling in the emptiness of the transcendence of extremes and the emptiness of the absence of beginning and end, teach the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: khams gsum po 'di ni /
analyzed: khams gsum po 'di ni /
translated: “This threefold universe

original: stong pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa ste /
translated: is empty.

original: 'di la gzugs sam /
analyzed: 'di la gzugs sam /
translated: There is no form here,

original: tshor ba'am / 'du shes sam /
analyzed: tshor ba'am / 'du shes sam /
translated: no feeling, no perception,

original: 'du byed dam /
analyzed: 'du byed dam /
translated: no volitional factors,

original: rnam par shes pa'am /🔽phung po rnams sam /🔽khams rnams sam /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'am / phung po rnams sam / khams rnams sam /
translated: and no consciousness.🔽There are no aggregates,🔽no constituents,

original: skye mched rnams med do //🔽'di ni / rmi lam /
analyzed: skye mched rnams med do // 'di ni / rmi lam /
translated: and no sense fields.🔽This is a dream,

original: 'di ni; sgra brnyan /
analyzed: 'di ni; sgra brnyan /
translated: this is an echo,🔽this is an optical illusion,🔽this is a mirage,🔽this is a magical creation.

original: 'di ni / mig yor /
analyzed: 'di ni / mig yor /
translated: This is a mirage.

original: 'di ni / sgyu ma /🔽'di ni / smig rgyu /
analyzed: 'di ni / sgyu ma / 'di ni / smig rgyu /
translated: This is an illusion.🔽This is a hallucination.

original: 'di ni / sprul pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni / sprul pa ste /
translated: This is a magical creation.

original: 'di la phung po rnams sam /🔽khams rnams sam /
analyzed: 'di la phung po rnams sam / khams rnams sam /
translated: Here there are no aggregates,🔽no constituents,

original: skye mched rnams med do //
analyzed: skye mched rnams med do //
translated: and no sense fields.

original: 'di la rmi lam med do; ;rmi lam mthong ba med do //🔽sgra brnyan med do //
analyzed: 'di la rmi lam med do; ;rmi lam mthong ba med do // sgra brnyan med do //
translated: Here there is no dream, and there is no one who sees a dream.

original: sgra brnyan nyan pa med do //🔽mig yor med do //
analyzed: sgra brnyan nyan pa med do // mig yor med do //
translated: There is no echo, and there is no one who hears an echo.

original: mig yor mthong ba med do //🔽sgyu ma med do //
analyzed: mig yor mthong ba med do // sgyu ma med do //
translated: There is no mirage, and there is no one who sees a mirage.

original: sgyu ma mthong ba med do //
analyzed: sgyu ma mthong ba med do //
translated: There is no illusion, and there is no one who sees an illusion.

original: smig rgyu med do; ;smig rgyu mthong ba med do //🔽sprul pa med do /
analyzed: smig rgyu med do; ;smig rgyu mthong ba med do // sprul pa med do /
translated: There is no hallucination, and there is no one who sees a hallucination.

original: sprul pa byed pa med do //
analyzed: sprul pa byed pa med do //
translated: There is no magical creation, and there is no one who creates a magical creation.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni /
translated: All these phenomena

original: dngos po med pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
translated: are non-entities, and their nature is non-entity.

original: 'on kyang khyod ni /🔽phung po med pa la phung por 'du shes pa /🔽khams med pa la khams su 'du shes pa /
analyzed: 'on kyang khyod ni / phung po med pa la phung por 'du shes pa / khams med pa la khams su 'du shes pa /
translated: However, you🔽perceive aggregates where there are no aggregates,🔽you perceive constituents where there are no constituents,

original: skye mched med pa la skye mched du 'du shes pa dag ste /
analyzed: skye mched med pa la skye mched du 'du shes pa dag ste /
translated: and you perceive sense fields where there are no sense fields.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni /
translated: All these phenomena

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba /
translated: dependent origination,

original: phyin ci log las skyes pa /
analyzed: phyin ci log las skyes pa /
translated: arisen from error,

original: las kyi rnam par smin pas yongs su bzung ba yin na /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pas yongs su bzung ba yin na /
translated: and are taken hold of by the ripening of karma,🔽why do you take things that are not real

original: khyed rnams ci'i phyir chos thams cad dngos po med pa la @515a *//🔽dngos po'i 'du shes su byed ces te /
analyzed: khyed rnams ci'i phyir chos thams cad dngos po med pa la @515a *// dngos po'i 'du shes su byed ces te /
translated: to be real?”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe thabs mkhas pas sems can ser sna can dag ser sna las rnam par bzlog nas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe thabs mkhas pas sems can ser sna can dag ser sna las rnam par bzlog nas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor te /
translated: When bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they use skillful means to turn stingy sentient beings away from stinginess and connect them to the perfection of generosity.

original: sbyin pa yongs su btang ba de'ang de dag la longs spyod chen po'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa yongs su btang ba de'ang de dag la longs spyod chen po'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: The generosity they give away becomes the cause for those beings to have great wealth.

original: des de dag de las bskyod nas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor te /
analyzed: des de dag de las bskyod nas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor te /
translated: Having turned them away from that, they connect them to the perfection of moral discipline.

original: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa de'ang de dag la mtho ris su skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa de'ang de dag la mtho ris su skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: The moral discipline they take up becomes the cause for those beings to be reborn in the higher realms.

original: des de dag de las bskyod nas ting nge 'dzin la sbyor te /
analyzed: des de dag de las bskyod nas ting nge 'dzin la sbyor te /
translated: He causes them to turn away from that and to apply themselves to meditative stabilization.

original: ting nge 'dzin de'ang de dag la tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de'ang de dag la tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: And that meditative stabilization becomes for them the cause for rebirth in the Brahma world.

original: des de dag de las bskyod nas bsam gtan dang po la sbyor te /
analyzed: des de dag de las bskyod nas bsam gtan dang po la sbyor te /
translated: He causes them to turn away from that and to apply themselves to the first concentration.

original: bsam gtan dang po las bskyod nas bsam gtan gnyis pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po las bskyod nas bsam gtan gnyis pa la sbyor ro //
translated: Having turned away from the first concentration, he causes them to apply themselves to the second concentration.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa las bskyod nas bsam gtan gsum pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa las bskyod nas bsam gtan gsum pa la sbyor ro //
translated: Having turned away from the second concentration, he causes them to apply themselves to the third concentration.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa las bskyod nas bsam gtan bzhi pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa las bskyod nas bsam gtan bzhi pa la sbyor ro //
translated: Having turned away from the third concentration, he causes them to apply themselves to the fourth concentration.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa las bskyod nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa las bskyod nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la sbyor ro //
translated: Having turned away from the fourth concentration, he causes them to apply themselves to the meditative absorption of the sphere of infinite space.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa las bskyod nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched @515b kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa las bskyod nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched @515b kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la sbyor ro //
translated: Having turned away from the meditative absorption of the sphere of infinite space, he causes them to apply themselves to the meditative absorption of the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa las bskyod nas cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa las bskyod nas cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la sbyor ro //
translated: Having emerged from the meditative attainment of the sphere of infinite consciousness, he applies himself to the meditative attainment of the sphere of nothingness.

original: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa las bskyod nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa las bskyod nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la sbyor ro //
translated: Having emerged from the meditative attainment of the sphere of nothingness, he applies himself to the meditative attainment of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: des sbyin pa dang sbyin pa'i 'bras bu dma' ba de las rnam grangs du mas bskyod de /
analyzed: des sbyin pa dang sbyin pa'i 'bras bu dma' ba de las rnam grangs du mas bskyod de /
translated: He causes him to turn away from that inferior generosity and its result by many ways,

original: phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su dbugs 'byin to //
analyzed: phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su dbugs 'byin to //
translated: and he inspires him with enthusiasm for the realm of nirvana without remainder.

original: gzhog go / rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: gzhog go / rab tu 'god do //
translated: He establishes him in it, he firmly places him in it, he makes him attain it.

original: des tshul khrims dang / tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu de las rnam grangs du mas bskyod de /
analyzed: des tshul khrims dang / tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu de las rnam grangs du mas bskyod de /
translated: He causes him to turn away from that inferior morality and its result by many ways,

original: phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rab tu gzhog go /
analyzed: phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rab tu gzhog go /
translated: and he inspires him with enthusiasm for the realm of nirvana without remainder.

original: des ting nge 'dzin dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu de las rnam grangs du mas bskyod de /
analyzed: des ting nge 'dzin dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu de las rnam grangs du mas bskyod de /
translated: It is by means of this that one is shaken from concentration and the results of concentration in many ways.

original: phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rab tu gzhog go /
analyzed: phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rab tu gzhog go /
translated: He causes them to enter into the meditative absorptions and the fruits of the meditative absorptions, and by many means he causes them to enter into the realm of nirvāṇa that is without remainder of the skandhas.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la yang dag par ston to //🔽yang dag par skul lo //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la yang dag par ston to // yang dag par skul lo //
translated: He teaches the four establishments of mindfulness.🔽He inspires them.

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod do //
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod do //
translated: He causes them to be uplifted.

original: yang dag par dga' bar byed do //🔽'dul lo // gzhog go /
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar byed do // 'dul lo // gzhog go /
translated: He causes them to rejoice.🔽He trains them.

original: rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: rab tu 'god do //
translated: He causes them to enter.🔽He causes them to be fully settled.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi la yang dag par ston to //🔽yang dag par skul lo //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi la yang dag par ston to // yang dag par skul lo //
translated: He teaches the four right efforts.🔽He inspires them.

original: @517b bstan du med pa /
analyzed: @517b bstan du med pa /
translated: he inspires,🔽he causes them to take it up,🔽he causes them to persevere,

original: thogs pa med pa de dag gis gang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu don du gnyer ba de dag rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa de dag gis gang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu don du gnyer ba de dag rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu 'god do //
translated: he causes them to be satisfied,🔽he disciplines,🔽he inspires,🔽he causes them to take it up,🔽he causes them to persevere,
