analyzed: gang lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu don du gnyer ba de dag lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu 'god do //
translated: those who seek the fruit of once-returning, he establishes in the fruit of once-returning;

original: gang phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu don du gnyer ba de dag phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: gang phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu don du gnyer ba de dag phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu 'god do //
translated: those who seek the fruit of non-returning, he establishes in the fruit of non-returning;

original: gang dgra bcom pa nyid don du gnyer ba de dag dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: gang dgra bcom pa nyid don du gnyer ba de dag dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu 'god do //
translated: those who seek the state of a worthy one, he establishes in the state of a worthy one;

original: gang rang byang chub don du gnyer ba de dag rang byang chub la rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: gang rang byang chub don du gnyer ba de dag rang byang chub la rab tu 'god do //
translated: those who seek individual enlightenment, he establishes in individual enlightenment;

original: gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer ba de dag byang chub kyi lam brjod cing ston to //🔽yang dag par skul lo //
analyzed: gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer ba de dag byang chub kyi lam brjod cing ston to // yang dag par skul lo //
translated: those who seek unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, he proclaims and teaches the path to awakening for them;🔽he inspires them;

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod do //
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod do //
translated: he encourages them;

original: yang dag par dga' bar byed do //🔽'dul lo // gzhog go /
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar byed do // 'dul lo // gzhog go /
translated: he delights them;🔽he trains them;

original: rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: rab tu 'god do //
translated: he establishes them;🔽he fully establishes them.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
translated: Subhūti, in that way

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu dang / sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu dang / sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang /
translated: like an echo, like an apparition, like an illusion, like a mirage,

original: sprul pa lta bu dang / dngos po med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la rnam par dgod par byed do //
analyzed: sprul pa lta bu dang / dngos po med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la rnam par dgod par byed do //
translated: like a magical creation, as non-entities, as the nature of non-entities, and as empty of their own marks.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: @518a *// bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: @518a *// bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i tshe chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / chos thams cad mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i tshe chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / chos thams cad mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang /
translated: “When bodhisattva great beings practice this profound perfection of wisdom in that way, all phenomena are the intrinsic nature of non-entityness,🔽the emptiness that transcends extremes,

original: thog ma dang tha ma ma mchis pa stong pa nyid la 'di dag ni /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma ma mchis pa stong pa nyid la 'di dag ni /
translated: and the emptiness that is without beginning or end.

original: dge ba'i chos so; ;'di dag ni /🔽mi dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos so; ;'di dag ni / mi dge ba'i chos so //
translated: They are virtuous phenomena,

original: 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'di dag ni /
translated: nonvirtuous phenomena,

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos so //🔽'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos so // 'di dag ni /
translated: mundane phenomena,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos so //🔽'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos so // 'di dag ni /
translated: supramundane phenomena,

original: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i chos so; ;'di dag ni /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i chos so; ;'di dag ni /
translated: phenomena with flaws,

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i chos so //🔽'di dag ni /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i chos so // 'di dag ni /
translated: phenomena without flaws,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos so //🔽'di dag ni /🔽zag pa med pa'i chos so //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos so // 'di dag ni / zag pa med pa'i chos so //
translated: phenomena with outflows,

original: 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'di dag ni /
translated: phenomena without outflows,

original: 'dus byas kyi chos so; ;'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos so; ;'di dag ni /
translated: conditioned phenomena,

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos so //🔽'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos so //🔽'di dag ni /
translated: and unconditioned phenomena.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //🔽'di dag ni /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o // 'di dag ni /
translated: They are the cause for actualizing the result of stream enterer.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //🔽'di dag ni /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o // 'di dag ni /
translated: They are the cause for actualizing the result of once-returner.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //🔽'di dag ni /🔽dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o // 'di dag ni / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They are the cause for actualizing the result of non-returner.

original: 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'di dag ni /
translated: They are the cause for actualizing the result of arhat.

original: rang byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'o //🔽'di dag ni /
analyzed: rang byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'o // 'di dag ni /
translated: They are the cause for pratyekabuddha awakening.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They are the cause for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: zhes bgyi bar @518b rnam par dgod par bgyid pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bgyi bar @518b rnam par dgod par bgyid pa ni /
translated: To set out these things

original: ngo mtshar te /
analyzed: ngo mtshar te /
translated: is a marvelous,

original: rmad du byung ba'i chos so //🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to; ;rab 'byor /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rmad du byung ba'i chos so // de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to; ;rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: wonderful Dharma.🔽Venerable Subhūti having said that, the Lord said to him, “Subhūti, it is so;

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: it is just as you have said.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i tshe chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / chos thams cad mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i tshe chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / chos thams cad mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang /
translated: They do not apprehend any phenomena that are empty of an extreme,

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la 'di dag ni /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la 'di dag ni /
translated: any phenomena that are empty of beginning and end,

original: dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos so //
translated: any virtuous phenomena,

original: 'di dag ni; mi dge ba'i chos so //🔽'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'di dag ni; mi dge ba'i chos so // 'di dag ni /
translated: any nonvirtuous phenomena,

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos so //🔽'di dag ni /🔽'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos so // 'di dag ni / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos so //
translated: any mundane phenomena,

original: 'di dag ni /🔽kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i chos so //🔽'di dag ni; kha na ma tho ba med pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i chos so // 'di dag ni; kha na ma tho ba med pa'i chos so //
translated: any supramundane phenomena,🔽any phenomena that are reprehensible,

original: 'di dag ni /🔽zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni / zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos so //
translated: any phenomena that are irreproachable,

original: 'di dag ni /🔽zag pa med pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni / zag pa med pa'i chos so //
translated: any phenomena that are contaminated,

original: 'di dag ni /🔽'dus byas kyi chos so; ;'di dag ni; 'dus ma byas kyi chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni / 'dus byas kyi chos so; ;'di dag ni; 'dus ma byas kyi chos so //
translated: any phenomena that are uncontaminated,🔽any conditioned phenomena,

original: 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'di dag ni /
translated: or any unconditioned phenomena.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //🔽'di dag ni /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o // 'di dag ni /
translated: They are the causes for actualizing the fruit of stream enterer.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //🔽'di dag ni /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o // 'di dag ni /
translated: They are the causes for actualizing the fruit of once-returner.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //🔽'di dag ni /🔽dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o // 'di dag ni / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They are the causes for actualizing the fruit of non-returner.

original: 'di dag @519a *//🔽ni; rang byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag @519a *// ni; rang byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They are the causes for actualizing the fruit of arhatship.

original: 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'di dag ni /
translated: They are the causes for pratyekabuddhahood.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'o //🔽zhes bya bar rnam par dgod pa byed pa de ni /🔽ngo mtshar te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'o // zhes bya bar rnam par dgod pa byed pa de ni / ngo mtshar te /
translated: They are the causes for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rmad du byung ba'i chos so //
analyzed: rmad du byung ba'i chos so //
translated: ’ That is a presentation of the marvelous and wonderful Dharma.

original: rab 'byor / gal te khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gi ngo mtshar rmad kyi chos de shes kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la slar phan gdags par bya bsla ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gi ngo mtshar rmad kyi chos de shes kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la slar phan gdags par bya bsla ba ma yin te /
translated: Subhuti, if you were to know the qualities of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's marvel and wonder, then all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas would not be able to repay the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's kindness.

original: khyed cag thams cad kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos de zil gyis mnan par mi nus so //
analyzed: khyed cag thams cad kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos de zil gyis mnan par mi nus so //
translated: Even all of you would not be able to surpass the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's qualities.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhuti said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad la ma mchis pa'i ngo mtshar rmad kyi chos byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la mchis pa gang lags /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad la ma mchis pa'i ngo mtshar rmad kyi chos byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la mchis pa gang lags /
translated: what are the qualities of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's marvel and wonder that are not found in all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
translated: The Bhagavān said:

original: de'i phyir shin tu legs par nyon la yid la gyis shig dang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shin tu legs par nyon la yid la gyis shig dang bshad par bya'o //
translated: Subhuti, listen well and keep it in mind! I will explain it.

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas /
translated: Subhūti, here when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom they stand in the six perfections that arise from the ripening of karma,

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i stong pa nyid thams cad la gnas /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i stong pa nyid thams cad la gnas /
translated: stand in all the emptinesses that arise from the ripening of karma,

original: rnam @519b par smin pa las byung ba'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la gnas /
analyzed: rnam @519b par smin pa las byung ba'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la gnas /
translated: stand in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening that arise from the ripening of karma,

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la gnas /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la gnas /
translated: stand in the four noble truths that arise from the ripening of karma,

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i bsam gtan bzhi la gnas /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i bsam gtan bzhi la gnas /
translated: stand in the four concentrations that arise from the ripening of karma,

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i tshad med pa bzhi la gnas /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i tshad med pa bzhi la gnas /
translated: stand in the four immeasurables that arise from the ripening of karma,

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la gnas /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la gnas /
translated: stand in the four formless absorptions that arise from the ripening of karma,

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i rnam par thar pa brgyad la gnas /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i rnam par thar pa brgyad la gnas /
translated: stand in the eight deliverances that arise from the ripening of karma,

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la gnas /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la gnas /
translated: They abide in the nine serial steps of meditative absorption that occur due to the ripening of past actions.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la gnas /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la gnas /
translated: They abide in the three doors of perfect liberation that occur due to the ripening of past actions—namely, emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa lnga la gnas /🔽rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin rnams la gnas /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa lnga la gnas / rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin rnams la gnas /
translated: They abide in the five kinds of supernormal knowledge that occur due to the ripening of past actions.🔽They abide in the meditative stabilities that occur due to the ripening of past actions.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i gzungs kyi sgo rnams la gnas /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i gzungs kyi sgo rnams la gnas /
translated: They abide in the dhāraṇī gateways that occur due to the ripening of past actions.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la gnas /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la gnas /
translated: They abide in the ten powers of the tathāgatas that occur due to the ripening of past actions.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mi 'jigs pa bzhi la gnas /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mi 'jigs pa bzhi la gnas /
translated: They abide in the four kinds of intrepid confidence that occur due to the ripening of past actions.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la gnas /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la gnas /
translated: They abide in the four kinds of exact knowledge that occur due to the ripening of past actions.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i byams pa chen po la gnas /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i byams pa chen po la gnas /
translated: They abide in the great love that occurs due to the ripening of past actions.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i snying rje chen po la gnas /🔽rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres @520a *//
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i snying rje chen po la gnas / rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres @520a *//
translated: They abide in the great compassion that arises from the ripening of karma.

original: pa bco brgyad la gnas shing /
analyzed: pa bco brgyad la gnas shing /
translated: They abide in the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas that arise from the ripening of karma.

original: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag tu song zhing sems can gang la sbyin pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /🔽sbyin pas phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag tu song zhing sems can gang la sbyin pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni / sbyin pas phan 'dogs so //
translated: They go to the world systems in all directions and benefit sentient beings with generosity.

original: sems can gang la tshul khrims kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /🔽tshul khrims kyis phan 'dogs so //🔽sems can gang la bzod pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /🔽bzod pas phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: sems can gang la tshul khrims kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni / tshul khrims kyis phan 'dogs so // sems can gang la bzod pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni / bzod pas phan 'dogs so //
translated: They benefit sentient beings with discipline.🔽They benefit sentient beings with patience.

original: sems can gang la brtson 'grus kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /🔽brtson 'grus kyis phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: sems can gang la brtson 'grus kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni / brtson 'grus kyis phan 'dogs so //
translated: They benefit sentient beings with diligence.

original: sems can gang la ting nge 'dzin gyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: sems can gang la ting nge 'dzin gyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: They benefit sentient beings with concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis phan 'dogs so //
translated: He benefits them through concentration.

original: sems can gang la shes rab kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: sems can gang la shes rab kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: He benefits those beings who should be benefited through wisdom

original: shes rab kyis phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyis phan 'dogs so //
translated: through wisdom.

original: sems can gang la bsam gtan dang pos phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: sems can gang la bsam gtan dang pos phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: He benefits those beings who should be benefited through the first concentration

original: bsam gtan dang pos phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang pos phan 'dogs so //
translated: through the first concentration.

original: sems can gang la bsam gtan gnyis pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: sems can gang la bsam gtan gnyis pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: He benefits those beings who should be benefited through the second concentration

original: bsam gtan gnyis pas phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pas phan 'dogs so //
translated: through the second concentration.🔽He benefits those beings who should be benefited through the third concentration

original: sems can gang la bsam gtan gsum pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni bsam gtan gsum pas phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: sems can gang la bsam gtan gsum pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni bsam gtan gsum pas phan 'dogs so //
translated: through the third concentration.

original: sems can gang la @520b bsam gtan bzhi pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: sems can gang la @520b bsam gtan bzhi pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: He benefits those beings who should be benefited through the fourth concentration

original: bsam gtan bzhi pas phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pas phan 'dogs so //
translated: through the fourth concentration.🔽He benefits those beings who should be benefited through the sphere of infinite space

original: sems can gang la nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: sems can gang la nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: through the sphere of infinite space.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pas phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pas phan 'dogs so //
translated: He benefits them by means of the concentration on the sphere of infinite space.

original: sems can gang la rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: sems can gang la rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: He benefits those beings who should be benefited by means of the concentration on the sphere of infinite consciousness

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pas phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pas phan 'dogs so //
translated: by means of the concentration on the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: sems can gang la cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: sems can gang la cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: He benefits those beings who should be benefited by means of the concentration on the sphere of nothingness

original: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pas phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pas phan 'dogs so //
translated: by means of the concentration on the sphere of nothingness.

original: sems can gang la 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: sems can gang la 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: He benefits those beings who should be benefited by means of the concentration on the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pas phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pas phan 'dogs so //
translated: by means of the concentration on the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: sems can gang la byams pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: sems can gang la byams pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: He benefits those beings who should be benefited by means of loving-kindness

original: byams pas phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: byams pas phan 'dogs so //
translated: He benefits them with loving kindness.

original: sems can gang la snying rjes phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: sems can gang la snying rjes phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: Those beings who are to be benefited with compassion

original: snying rjes phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: snying rjes phan 'dogs so //
translated: he benefits with compassion.

original: sems can gang la dga' bas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: sems can gang la dga' bas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: Those beings who are to be benefited with sympathetic joy

original: dga' bas phan 'dogs so //🔽sems can gang la btang @521a *//
analyzed: dga' bas phan 'dogs so // sems can gang la btang @521a *//
translated: he benefits with sympathetic joy.

original: snyoms kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: snyoms kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: Those beings who are to be benefited with equanimity

original: btang snyoms kyis phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyis phan 'dogs so //
translated: he benefits with equanimity.

original: sems can gang la dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: sems can gang la dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: Those beings who are to be benefited with the four establishments of mindfulness

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhis phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhis phan 'dogs so //
translated: he benefits with the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: sems can gang la yang dag par spong ba bzhis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: sems can gang la yang dag par spong ba bzhis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: Those beings who are to be benefited with the four right efforts

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhis phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhis phan 'dogs so //
translated: he benefits with the four right efforts.

original: sems can gang la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: sems can gang la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: Those beings who are to be benefited with the four legs of supernatural power🔽he benefits with the four legs of supernatural power.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhis phan 'dogs so; ;sems can gang la dbang po lngas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /🔽dbang po lngas phan 'dogs so //🔽sems can gang la stobs lngas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhis phan 'dogs so; ;sems can gang la dbang po lngas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni / dbang po lngas phan 'dogs so // sems can gang la stobs lngas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: I benefit with the four bases of supernatural powers.🔽I benefit with the five faculties.

original: stobs lngas phan 'dogs so //🔽sems can gang la byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: stobs lngas phan 'dogs so // sems can gang la byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: I benefit with the five powers.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyis phan 'dogs so //🔽sems can gang la 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyis phan 'dogs so // sems can gang la 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: I benefit with the seven factors of awakening.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pas phan 'dogs so //🔽sems can gang la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pas phan 'dogs so // sems can gang la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: I benefit with the noble eightfold path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhis phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhis phan 'dogs so //
translated: I benefit with the four noble truths.

original: sems can gang @521b la rnams par thar pa brgyad kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: sems can gang @521b la rnams par thar pa brgyad kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: Those beings who are to be benefited by the eight liberations,

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad kyis phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad kyis phan 'dogs so //
translated: he benefits with the eight liberations.

original: sems can gang la mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgus phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: sems can gang la mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgus phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: Those beings who are to be benefited by the nine serial steps of meditative absorption,

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgus phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgus phan 'dogs so //
translated: he benefits with the nine serial steps of meditative absorption.

original: sems can gang la stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: sems can gang la stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: Those beings who are to be benefited by the meditative absorption of emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis phan 'dogs so //
translated: he benefits with the meditative absorption of emptiness.

original: sems can gang la mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: sems can gang la mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: Those beings who are to be benefited by the meditative absorption of signlessness,

original: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis phan 'dogs so //
translated: he benefits with the meditative absorption of signlessness.

original: sems can gang la smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: sems can gang la smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: Those beings who are to be benefited by the meditative absorption of aspirationlessness,🔽he benefits with the meditative absorption of aspirationlessness.

original: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis phan 'dogs so //🔽sems can gang la mngon par shes pa rnams kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis phan 'dogs so // sems can gang la mngon par shes pa rnams kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: He benefits them with the concentration of wishlessness.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams kyis phan 'dogs so //🔽sems can gang la ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams kyis phan 'dogs so // sems can gang la ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: He benefits those sentient beings who are to be benefited by the superknowledges with the superknowledges.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyis phan 'dogs so //🔽sems can gang la de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcus phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyis phan 'dogs so // sems can gang la de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcus phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: He benefits those sentient beings who are to be benefited by the concentrations and the doors of concentration with the concentrations and the doors of concentration.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcus phan 'dogs so //🔽sems can gang la mi 'jigs pa bzhis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcus phan 'dogs so // sems can gang la mi 'jigs pa bzhis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: He benefits those sentient beings who are to be benefited by the ten powers of the Tathāgata with the ten powers of the Tathāgata.

original: @522a *// mi 'jigs pa bzhis phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: @522a *// mi 'jigs pa bzhis phan 'dogs so //
translated: He benefits those sentient beings who are to be benefited by the four fearlessnesses with the four fearlessnesses.

original: sems can gang la so so yang dag par rig pa bzhis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: sems can gang la so so yang dag par rig pa bzhis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: He benefits those sentient beings who are to be benefited by the four detailed and thorough knowledges with the four detailed and thorough knowledges.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhis phan 'dogs so //🔽sems can gang la sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhis phan 'dogs so // sems can gang la sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: They benefit through the four right discriminations.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyis phan 'dogs so //🔽sems can gang la snying rje chen pos phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyis phan 'dogs so // sems can gang la snying rje chen pos phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: Those who are to be benefited by the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha are benefited by the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha.

original: snying rje chen pos phan 'dogs so //🔽sems can gang la thams cad shes pa nyid kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: snying rje chen pos phan 'dogs so // sems can gang la thams cad shes pa nyid kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: Those who are to be benefited by great compassion are benefited by great compassion.

original: thams cad shes pa nyid kyis phan 'dogs so //🔽sems can gang la lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid kyis phan 'dogs so // sems can gang la lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: Those who are to be benefited by the knowledge of all aspects are benefited by the knowledge of all aspects.

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyis phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyis phan 'dogs so //
translated: Those who are to be benefited by the knowledge of the modes of the path are benefited by the knowledge of the modes of the path.🔽Those who are to be benefited by the knowledge of all paths are benefited by the knowledge of all paths.

original: sems can gang la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
analyzed: sems can gang la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni /
translated: Those who are to be benefited by the knowledge of all aspects are benefited by the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis phan 'dogs so //
translated: and the knowledge of all aspects benefits them.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ji ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar na /
translated: how

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pas sems can rnams la sman 'dogs pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pas sems can rnams la sman 'dogs pa lags /
translated: do bodhisattva great beings benefit beings through generosity?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha @522b rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe zas 'dod pa rnams la zas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha @522b rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe zas 'dod pa rnams la zas /
translated: “Subhūti, here when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they give food to those who want food,

original: skom 'dod pa rnams la skom /
analyzed: skom 'dod pa rnams la skom /
translated: drink to those who want drink,

original: bzhon pa 'dod pa rnams la bzhon pa /🔽phreng ba 'dod pa rnams la phreng ba /
analyzed: bzhon pa 'dod pa rnams la bzhon pa / phreng ba 'dod pa rnams la phreng ba /
translated: vehicles to those who want vehicles,🔽garlands to those who want garlands,🔽incense to those who want incense,

original: spos 'dod pa rnams la spos /🔽byung pa 'dod pa rnams la byug pa /🔽gos 'dod pa rnams la gos /
analyzed: spos 'dod pa rnams la spos / byung pa 'dod pa rnams la byug pa / gos 'dod pa rnams la gos /
translated: ointments to those who want ointments,🔽clothes to those who want clothes,

original: mal cha 'dod pa rnams la mal cha /
analyzed: mal cha 'dod pa rnams la mal cha /
translated: beds to those who want beds,

original: gnas 'dod pa rnams la gnas /
analyzed: gnas 'dod pa rnams la gnas /
translated: and dwellings to those who want dwellings.

original: nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byu ru dang / gser dang / dngul 'dod pa rnams la nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / man shel dang /
analyzed: nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byu ru dang / gser dang / dngul 'dod pa rnams la nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / man shel dang /
translated: They give jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, quartz, coral, gold, and silver to those who want jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, quartz, coral, gold, and silver, up to giving any human necessities that are wanted.

original: byu ru dang / gser dang / dngul gyi sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba nas mi'i yo byad gang yang rung ba'i bar du yongs su gtong ste /
analyzed: byu ru dang / gser dang / dngul gyi sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba nas mi'i yo byad gang yang rung ba'i bar du yongs su gtong ste /
translated: They give jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, quartz, coral, gold, and silver, up to giving any human necessities that are wanted.

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la dbul zhing yongs su gtong ba dang / ji ltar rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la dbul zhing yongs su gtong ba dang / ji ltar rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang /
translated: They give to the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas, and similarly to the pratyekabuddhas, the arhats, the non-returners, the once-returners, the stream enterers, and the ordinary beings.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dang / yang dag par song ba rnams dang / yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la yongs su gtong ba de bzhin du mir gyur ba rnams dang / de bzhin du byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad la'ang tha dad du bya ba med pa'i 'du shes nye bar gzhag cing sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dang / yang dag par song ba rnams dang / yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la yongs su gtong ba de bzhin du mir gyur ba rnams dang / de bzhin du byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad la'ang tha dad du bya ba med pa'i 'du shes nye bar gzhag cing sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo //
translated: In the same way, he gives gifts to humans, and in the same way, he gives gifts to all beings in the animal world, without making any distinction, without differentiating.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar chos thams @523a *//
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar chos thams @523a *//
translated: And why?

original: cad ni; tha dad du bya ba med pa ste /🔽des tha dad du bya ba med pa'i sbyin pa byin pas tha dad du bya ba med pa'i chos 'di lta ste /
analyzed: cad ni; tha dad du bya ba med pa ste / des tha dad du bya ba med pa'i sbyin pa byin pas tha dad du bya ba med pa'i chos 'di lta ste /
translated: Because all dharmas are undifferentiated.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: He gives an undifferentiated gift, and by giving an undifferentiated gift he will attain an undifferentiated dharma, namely, the knowledge of all modes.

original: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i srog chags sbyin pa'i gnas ma yin pa mthong nas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i srog chags sbyin pa'i gnas ma yin pa mthong nas 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva, seeing a being belonging to the animal realm who is not a recipient of generosity, thinks,

original: bdag gi sbyin gnas ni /
analyzed: bdag gi sbyin gnas ni /
translated: “My recipient of generosity

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas te /
translated: is the perfect, complete Buddha,

original: byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: not one belonging to the animal realm,”

original: snyam na / byang chub sems dpa'i chos ma yin no //
analyzed: snyam na / byang chub sems dpa'i chos ma yin no //
translated: that is not the Dharma of the bodhisattvas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni /
translated: Because bodhisattva mahāsattvas,

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /
translated: having given rise to the mind of awakening,🔽think,

original: 'di ltar bdag gis sems can 'di dag la ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis sems can 'di dag la ni /
translated: “I will benefit these sentient beings

original: sbyin pas phan gdags par bya'o //🔽'di dag la ni /
analyzed: sbyin pas phan gdags par bya'o // 'di dag la ni /
translated: through generosity.

original: phan gdags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: phan gdags par mi bya'o //
translated: I will not benefit these ones.

original: zhes bya bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa ma yin te; de dag sbyin pas phan btags nas rgyal rigs che zhing mtho ba'i rigs su skye /
analyzed: zhes bya bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa ma yin te; de dag sbyin pas phan btags nas rgyal rigs che zhing mtho ba'i rigs su skye /
translated: They do not set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bram ze che zhing mtho ba'i rigs su skye /
analyzed: bram ze che zhing mtho ba'i rigs su skye /
translated: Having benefited them through generosity, they are reborn in a high-ranking family of brahmins,

original: khyim bdag che zhing mtho ba'i rigs su skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyim bdag che zhing mtho ba'i rigs su skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: in a high-ranking family of householders,

original: sbyin pa de nyid kyis phan btags pa de dag theg pa gsum rim gyis phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das par @523b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa de nyid kyis phan btags pa de dag theg pa gsum rim gyis phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das par @523b 'gyur ro //
translated: and through that generosity they benefit them, and they all pass into complete nirvāṇa in the element of nirvāṇa without any remainder of the skandhas by means of the three vehicles.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la skye bo'i tshogs thams cad kyis gsad par gsol ba btab na /🔽de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin no; ;snyam pa'am /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la skye bo'i tshogs thams cad kyis gsad par gsol ba btab na / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin no; ;snyam pa'am /
translated: “If all the people in a community were to request a bodhisattva great being to kill them,🔽the bodhisattva great being should not think, ‘I will give it,’

original: mi sbyin no //
analyzed: mi sbyin no //
translated: or think, ‘I will not give it.’

original: snyam pa'i sems gzhan bskyed par mi bya'i /
analyzed: snyam pa'i sems gzhan bskyed par mi bya'i /
translated: He should not arouse any other thought.

original: 'khrug pa med pa'i sems kyis skye bo'i tshogs de dag la sbyin par bya'o /
analyzed: 'khrug pa med pa'i sems kyis skye bo'i tshogs de dag la sbyin par bya'o /
translated: He should give to those beings with a mind free from disturbance.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni /
translated: Because

original: sems can thams cad kyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa'i phyir gal te rnam par rtog na /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa'i phyir gal te rnam par rtog na /
translated: he has set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for the sake of all beings. If he conceptualizes,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / slob pa rnams dang / lha dang / mi dang // lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis smad par 'gyur te /🔽de la thog mar sems can thams cad kyi mgon gyis shig ce'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / slob pa rnams dang / lha dang / mi dang // lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis smad par 'gyur te / de la thog mar sems can thams cad kyi mgon gyis shig ce'am /
translated: he will be criticized by those lord buddhas, those bodhisattva great beings, those pratyekabuddhas, those worthy ones, those learners, and by the world with its gods, people, and asuras.🔽He will be criticized by those who say, ‘First be a protector of all beings!

original: gnas dang / skyabs dang / dpung gnyen gyis shig ces sus gsol ba btab ces smad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas dang / skyabs dang / dpung gnyen gyis shig ces sus gsol ba btab ces smad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Be a refuge, a shelter, and a friend!’”

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du mir gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du mir gyur ba'am /
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, if a man or a woman should come to a Bodhisattva who is coursing in the perfection of wisdom and should say to him:🔽

original: mi ma yin par gyur pa dag 'ongs nas bdag ni /
analyzed: mi ma yin par gyur pa dag 'ongs nas bdag ni /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, if humans or non-humans come to a bodhisattva-mahāsattva and request,

original: slongs mo pa'o //
analyzed: slongs mo pa'o //
translated: “I am a beggar.🔽Please give me

original: zhes yan lag dang / nying lag bcad par gsol ba btab na /🔽de'i tshe des sbyin nam mi sbyin snyam pa'i sems gnyis su bskyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhes yan lag dang / nying lag bcad par gsol ba btab na / de'i tshe des sbyin nam mi sbyin snyam pa'i sems gnyis su bskyed par mi bya'o //
translated: my limbs and minor parts,”

original: de ci'i @524a *//
analyzed: de ci'i @524a *//
translated: at that time he should not give rise to two thoughts, thinking “Should I give or not give?”

original: phyir zhe na /🔽de ni / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des sems can rnams kyi don du ched du bsam ste lus 'dis bdag gis sems can thams cad kyi don bya'o //
analyzed: phyir zhe na / de ni / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des sems can rnams kyi don du ched du bsam ste lus 'dis bdag gis sems can thams cad kyi don bya'o //
translated: Why is that?🔽Because that bodhisattva-mahāsattva, for the sake of sentient beings, intentionally and with a focused mind,

original: zhes lus yongs su bzung bas na /
analyzed: zhes lus yongs su bzung bas na /
translated: “With this body, I will work for the welfare of all sentient beings.”

original: des 'di snyam du bdag gis sems can 'di dag gi don du lus yongs su bzung bzung bas de dag bslang mi dgos pas khyer zhing dengs shig ces sems bskyed par byas te /
analyzed: des 'di snyam du bdag gis sems can 'di dag gi don du lus yongs su bzung bzung bas de dag bslang mi dgos pas khyer zhing dengs shig ces sems bskyed par byas te /
translated: Therefore, he should think, “Since I have taken on this body for the sake of these sentient beings, without their asking, may they take it and go.”

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: In this way, Subhūti, should the bodhisattva great beings train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos slongs mo pa mthong na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos slongs mo pa mthong na /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings see beggars,

original: 'di snyam du chos 'di dag thams cad kyi rang bzhin dmigs su med na; 'di la su zhig ni /🔽sbyin pa yongs su gtong /🔽su la ni /
analyzed: 'di snyam du chos 'di dag thams cad kyi rang bzhin dmigs su med na; 'di la su zhig ni / sbyin pa yongs su gtong / su la ni /
translated: they should think, ‘The intrinsic nature of all these dharmas is unobservable.🔽Who here is giving?

original: sbyin par bya /🔽ci zhig ni /
analyzed: sbyin par bya / ci zhig ni /
translated: To whom is it given?🔽What is given?

original: sbyin par bya zhes sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin par bya zhes sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: What is the giving?’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di ltar / chos de dag ni; mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar / chos de dag ni; mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis stong pa ste /
translated: Because those dharmas are empty of the emptiness that transcends extremes.

original: stong pa nyid la ni /🔽gang la'ang yongs su gtong ba'am /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la ni / gang la'ang yongs su gtong ba'am /
translated: In emptiness🔽there is nothing to give away

original: gang las kyang 'phrog pa med do //
analyzed: gang las kyang 'phrog pa med do //
translated: or to take away from anything.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / 'di lta ste /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, should the bodhisattva great beings train in the perfection of wisdom, namely,

original: nang stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dam /
translated: the emptiness of internal phenomena,

original: phyi stong pa nyid dam /🔽phyi nang stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid dam / phyi nang stong pa nyid dam /
translated: the emptiness of external phenomena,🔽the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena,

original: stong pa nyid stong @524b pa nyid dam /
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong @524b pa nyid dam /
translated: the emptiness of emptiness,

original: chen po stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid dam /
translated: the emptiness of great extent,

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid dam /🔽'dus byas stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid dam / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dam /
translated: the emptiness of ultimate reality,🔽the emptiness of conditioned phenomena,

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dam /🔽mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dam /🔽thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid ma /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dam / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dam / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid ma /
translated: the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena,🔽the emptiness of the unlimited,🔽the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end,

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dam /
translated: the emptiness of non-dispersal,

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid dam /
translated: the emptiness of inherent existence,

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid dam /
translated: the emptiness of all phenomena,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dam /
translated: the emptiness of intrinsic characteristics,🔽the emptiness of non-apprehension,

original: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dam; dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dam; dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dam /
translated: the emptiness of non-entities,

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dam /
translated: the emptiness of essential nature,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la bslab par bya'o //
translated: and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: de stong pa nyid de dag la gnas shing sbyin pa gtong na /
analyzed: de stong pa nyid de dag la gnas shing sbyin pa gtong na /
translated: “If they abide in those emptinesses and practice generosity,

original: de'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug tu rgyun mi 'chad par yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /🔽de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa des phyi dang nang gi chos la bcad cing gtubs kyang bdag la su'ang gtub pa'am /
analyzed: de'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug tu rgyun mi 'chad par yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te / de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa des phyi dang nang gi chos la bcad cing gtubs kyang bdag la su'ang gtub pa'am /
translated: His perfection of generosity will be uninterrupted and complete in six perfections.🔽Through the perfection of generosity being complete, he will cut and chop up his outer and inner

original: gcod do // snyam pa'i sems mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gcod do // snyam pa'i sems mi 'byung ngo //
translated: dharmas, but the thought will not occur to him, “I am cutting or chopping up.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa //
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines

original: bam po nyis brgya don brgyad pa //
analyzed: bam po nyis brgya don brgyad pa //
translated: In the two hundred fifty-eighth fascicle

original: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
translated: Subhūti, having looked with the Buddha eye at the world from here,

original: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag ched du bsam ste sems can dmyal ba chen po dag tu dong zhing /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag ched du bsam ste sems can dmyal ba chen po dag tu dong zhing /
translated: I see bodhisattva great beings in the east in as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River intentionally going to the great hells

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal zhi bar byas nas @525a *//
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal zhi bar byas nas @525a *//
translated: and pacifying the suffering of the great hells,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul dang / yongs su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang cho 'phrul gsum po de dag gis sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can de dag la chos ston cing /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul dang / yongs su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang cho 'phrul gsum po de dag gis sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can de dag la chos ston cing /
translated: They teach the Dharma to the beings in the hells by means of the three kinds of miracles: the miracle of psychic power, the miracle of reading others’ minds, and the miracle of instruction.🔽They pacify the suffering of the beings in the hells by means of the miracle of psychic power, and they teach the Dharma by means of the miracle of reading others’ minds and the miracle of instruction.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis sems can dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal de dag zhi bar byas te yongs su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis chos ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag byams pa chen po dang /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis sems can dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal de dag zhi bar byas te yongs su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis chos ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag byams pa chen po dang /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings teach the Dharma with great love,🔽great compassion,

original: snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen pos chos ston te /
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen pos chos ston te /
translated: great joy, and great equanimity.

original: des sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la sems mos par byas shing /
analyzed: des sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la sems mos par byas shing /
translated: The beings in the hells, having developed trust in those bodhisattva great beings,

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po de dag nas rnam par ldang ba dang / de dag sems can dmyal ba chen po de dag nas rnam par langs nas lha dang mi dag dang skal ba mnyam par skyes shing /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po de dag nas rnam par ldang ba dang / de dag sems can dmyal ba chen po de dag nas rnam par langs nas lha dang mi dag dang skal ba mnyam par skyes shing /
translated: and having emerged from those great hells, they are reborn among the gods and humans,

original: rim gyis theg pa gsum gyis sdug bsngal mthar 'byin pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: rim gyis theg pa gsum gyis sdug bsngal mthar 'byin pa mthong ngo //
translated: and gradually put an end to suffering by means of the three vehicles.

original: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
translated: Subhūti, when I look down with my buddha-eye on the world,

original: lho phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag ched du bsam ste sems can dmyal ba chen po dag tu dong @525b zhing /
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag ched du bsam ste sems can dmyal ba chen po dag tu dong @525b zhing /
translated: I see bodhisattva great beings who intentionally go to the great hells in as many world systems in the south as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River,

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal zhi bar byas nas rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul dang / yongs su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i chos 'phrul dang cho 'phrul gsum pa de dag gis sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can de dag la chos ston cing /🔽rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis sems can dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal de dag zhi bar byas te yongs su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis chos ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag byams pa chen po dang /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal zhi bar byas nas rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul dang / yongs su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i chos 'phrul dang cho 'phrul gsum pa de dag gis sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can de dag la chos ston cing / rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis sems can dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal de dag zhi bar byas te yongs su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis chos ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag byams pa chen po dang /
translated: Having pacified the sufferings of the great hells, they teach the Dharma to the beings in the hells by means of the three kinds of miracles: the miracle of magical transformation, the miracle of reading others’ minds, and the miracle of instruction.🔽By means of the miracle of magical transformation they pacify the sufferings of the great hells, and by means of the miracle of reading others’ minds and the miracle of instruction they teach the Dharma.

original: snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen pos chos ston te /
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen pos chos ston te /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings teach the Dharma with great love,🔽great compassion,🔽great joy, and great equanimity.

original: des sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la sems mos par byas shing /
analyzed: des sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la sems mos par byas shing /
translated: They cause the beings in the hells to have faith in those bodhisattva great beings,

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po de dag nas rnam par ldang ba dang / de dag sems can dmyal ba chen po de dag nas rnam par langs nas lha dang mi dag dang skal ba mnyam par skyes shing /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po de dag nas rnam par ldang ba dang / de dag sems can dmyal ba chen po de dag nas rnam par langs nas lha dang mi dag dang skal ba mnyam par skyes shing /
translated: and they emerge from those great hells, and having emerged from those great hells, they are reborn with the lot of gods and humans,

original: rim gyis theg pa gsum gyis sdug bsngal mthar 'byin pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: rim gyis theg pa gsum gyis sdug bsngal mthar 'byin pa mthong ngo //
translated: and gradually put an end to suffering by means of the three vehicles.

original: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
translated: “Subhūti, having looked with the eye of a buddha at the world with my buddha eye,

original: nub phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag ched du bsam ste sems can @526a *//
analyzed: nub phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag ched du bsam ste sems can @526a *//
translated: I see bodhisattva great beings in the west in as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River who intentionally take birth

original: dmyal ba chen po dag tu song zhing sems can dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal zhi bar byas nas rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul dang / yongs su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang cho 'phrul gsum po de dag gis sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can de dag la chos ston cing /🔽rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis sems can dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal de dag zhi bar byas te yongs su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyi chos ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag byams pa chen po dang /

translated: They go to the great hells and, having pacified the suffering of the beings in the great hells, they teach the Dharma to those beings in the hells by means of the three kinds of miracles: the miracle of psychic power, the miracle of reading others’ minds, and the miracle of instruction.🔽By means of the miracle of psychic power they pacify the suffering of the great hells and they teach the Dharma by means of the miracle of reading others’ minds and the miracle of instruction.
