original: sems can dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal zhi bar byas nas rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul dang / yongs su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang cho 'phrul gsum po de dag gis sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can de dag la chos ston cing /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal zhi bar byas nas rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul dang / yongs su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang cho 'phrul gsum po de dag gis sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can de dag la chos ston cing /
translated: and, having pacified the suffering of the great hells, they teach the Dharma to the hell beings through the three kinds of miracles—the miracle of magical transformation, the miracle of mind-reading, and the miracle of instruction.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis sems can dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal de dag zhi bar byas te yongs su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis chos ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag byams pa chen po dang /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis sems can dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal de dag zhi bar byas te yongs su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis chos ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag byams pa chen po dang /
translated: Through the miraculous power of their magical power they pacify the sufferings of the great hells, and through the power of teaching and the power of instruction they teach the Dharma.🔽Those bodhisattva great beings teach the Dharma with great love,

original: snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen pos chos ston te /
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen pos chos ston te /
translated: great compassion,🔽great joy, and great equanimity.

original: des sems can dmyal ba pa'i @529b sems can de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la sems mos par byas shing /
analyzed: des sems can dmyal ba pa'i @529b sems can de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la sems mos par byas shing /
translated: Through that, the beings in the hells develop faith in those bodhisattva great beings,

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po de dag nas rnam par ldang ba dang / de dag sems can dmyal ba chen po de dag nas rnam par langs nas lha dang mi dag dang skal pa mnyam par skyes shing /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po de dag nas rnam par ldang ba dang / de dag sems can dmyal ba chen po de dag nas rnam par langs nas lha dang mi dag dang skal pa mnyam par skyes shing /
translated: and they rise up from those great hells, and having risen up from those great hells, they are reborn with the same fortune as gods and humans.

original: rim gyis theg pa gsum gyis sdug bsngal mthar 'byin pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: rim gyis theg pa gsum gyis sdug bsngal mthar 'byin pa mthong ngo //
translated: and gradually, through the three vehicles, they will put an end to suffering.

original: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
translated: Subhūti, I see with my buddha-eye

original: steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag ched du bsam ste sems can dmyal pa chen po dag tu dong zhing /
analyzed: steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag ched du bsam ste sems can dmyal pa chen po dag tu dong zhing /
translated: that in the worlds in the ten directions, in as many worlds as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River, bodhisattva great beings intentionally go to the great hells,

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal zhi bar byas nas rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul dang / yongs su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang cho 'phrul gsum po de dag gis sems can dmyal ba ba'i sems can de dag la chos ston cing /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal zhi bar byas nas rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul dang / yongs su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang cho 'phrul gsum po de dag gis sems can dmyal ba ba'i sems can de dag la chos ston cing /
translated: and after they have pacified the suffering of the great hells, they teach the Dharma to the beings in the hells with the three kinds of miracles: the miracle of psychic power, the miracle of reading minds, and the miracle of instruction.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis sems can dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal de dag zhi bar byas te yongs su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis chos ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag byams pa chen po dang /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis sems can dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal de dag zhi bar byas te yongs su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis chos ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag byams pa chen po dang /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings teach the Dharma with great love,🔽great compassion,🔽great joy,

original: snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms @530a *//🔽chen pos chos ston te /
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms @530a *// chen pos chos ston te /
translated: and great equanimity.

original: des sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la sems mos par byas shing /
analyzed: des sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la sems mos par byas shing /
translated: Through that, the beings in the hells bring to mind those bodhisattva great beings,

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po de dag nas rnam par ldang ba dang / de dag sems can dmyal ba chen po de dag nas rnam par langs nas lha dang mi dag dang skal ba mnyam par skyes shing /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po de dag nas rnam par ldang ba dang / de dag sems can dmyal ba chen po de dag nas rnam par langs nas lha dang mi dag dang skal ba mnyam par skyes shing /
translated: and they rise up from those great hells, and having risen up from those great hells, they are reborn with the good fortune of gods and humans.

original: rim gyis theg pa gsum gyis sdug bsngal mthar 'byin pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: rim gyis theg pa gsum gyis sdug bsngal mthar 'byin pa mthong ngo //
translated: and gradually, through the three vehicles, they will put an end to suffering.

original: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nyid nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nyid nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
translated: “Subhūti, I see with my buddha-eye

original: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa rnams mthong ste /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa rnams mthong ste /
translated: that in the eastern direction, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, there are bodhisattva great beings who are serving the blessed buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la dgyes par mi 'gyur bas ma yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la dgyes par mi 'gyur bas ma yin gyi /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings are not doing so out of dislike for those blessed buddhas,🔽but out of fondness;

original: dgyes par 'gyur ba dang / thugs su mi byon pas ma yin gyi /🔽thugs su byon pa dang / ma gus pas ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dgyes par 'gyur ba dang / thugs su mi byon pas ma yin gyi / thugs su byon pa dang / ma gus pas ma yin gyi /
translated: not out of disregard,

original: gus par shin tu dad pas bsnyen bkur byed cing /
analyzed: gus par shin tu dad pas bsnyen bkur byed cing /
translated: but out of respect, with great faith.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis chos gang bstan pa de'ang 'dzin cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis chos gang bstan pa de'ang 'dzin cing /
translated: The lord buddhas teach those bodhisattva great beings the Dharma, and they retain it.

original: bzung nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs @530b pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du 'chang zhing nam du'ang chud mi gzon to /🔽rab 'byor / ngas 'di nyid nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
analyzed: bzung nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs @530b pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du 'chang zhing nam du'ang chud mi gzon to / rab 'byor / ngas 'di nyid nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
translated: Having retained it, they hold it until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and they never lose it.

original: lho phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa rnams mthong ste /
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa rnams mthong ste /
translated: “Subhūti, I see with my buddha eye the world systems in the southern direction, as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River, where bodhisattva great beings are serving the lord buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la dgyes par mi 'gyur bas ma yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la dgyes par mi 'gyur bas ma yin gyi /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings are not doing so because they do not delight in those lord buddhas.

original: dgyes par 'gyur ba dang / thugs su mi byon pas ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dgyes par 'gyur ba dang / thugs su mi byon pas ma yin gyi /
translated: not because they are not pleased, nor because they are not satisfied,

original: thugs su byon pa dang / ma gus pas ma yin gyi /
analyzed: thugs su byon pa dang / ma gus pas ma yin gyi /
translated: but because they are pleased and satisfied, and not out of disrespect,

original: gus par shin tu dad pas bsnyen bkur byed cing /
analyzed: gus par shin tu dad pas bsnyen bkur byed cing /
translated: but out of respect, with great faith they serve them.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis chos gang bstan pa de'ang 'dzin cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis chos gang bstan pa de'ang 'dzin cing /
translated: And whatever Dharma those Bodhisattva Mahasattvas are taught by those Buddha Bhagavats, they also take it up,

original: bzung nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du 'chang zhing nam du'ang chud mi gzon to //
analyzed: bzung nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du 'chang zhing nam du'ang chud mi gzon to //
translated: and having taken it up, they hold it until they fully and completely awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, and they never lose it.

original: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nyid nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nyid nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
translated: Subhuti, I now look out over the world with my Buddha-eye

original: nub phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa rnams mthong @531a *//🔽ste; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la dgyes par mi 'gyur bas ma yin gyi /🔽dgyes par 'gyur ba dang / thugs su mi byon pas ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nub phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa rnams mthong @531a *// ste; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la dgyes par mi 'gyur bas ma yin gyi / dgyes par 'gyur ba dang / thugs su mi byon pas ma yin gyi /
translated: “They see bodhisattva mahāsattvas in the western buddha realms in the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, who are serving the bhagavān buddhas.🔽Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas are not serving those bhagavān buddhas because they are displeased,🔽but because they are pleased; they are not serving those bhagavān buddhas because they are not attentive,

original: thugs su byon pa dang / ma gus pas ma yin gyi /
analyzed: thugs su byon pa dang / ma gus pas ma yin gyi /
translated: but because they are attentive; they are not serving those bhagavān buddhas without respect,

original: gus par shin tu dad pas bsnyen bkur byed cing /
analyzed: gus par shin tu dad pas bsnyen bkur byed cing /
translated: but with respect and with great faith.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis chos gang bstan pa de'ang 'dzin cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis chos gang bstan pa de'ang 'dzin cing /
translated: “Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas retain the Dharma that those bhagavān buddhas teach.

original: bzung nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du 'chang zhing nam du'ang chud mi gzon to //
analyzed: bzung nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du 'chang zhing nam du'ang chud mi gzon to //
translated: and having taken them up, they will hold them until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and they will never lose them.

original: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nyid nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nyid nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
translated: “Subhūti, I, right here, having looked with the eye of a buddha,

original: byang phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
translated: see in the world systems in the northern direction, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa rnams mthong ste /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das da dag la dgyes par mi 'gyur bas ma yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa rnams mthong ste / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das da dag la dgyes par mi 'gyur bas ma yin gyi /
translated: bodhisattva great beings who are attending on the lord buddhas.🔽Those bodhisattva great beings are not attending on those lord buddhas because they are not pleased,

original: dgyes par 'gyur ba dang / thugs su mi byon pas ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dgyes par 'gyur ba dang / thugs su mi byon pas ma yin gyi /
translated: but because they are pleased; they are not attending on those lord buddhas because they are not favorably inclined,

original: thugs su byon pa dang / ma gus pas ma yin gyi /
analyzed: thugs su byon pa dang / ma gus pas ma yin gyi /
translated: but because they are favorably inclined; they are not attending on those lord buddhas because they are disrespectful,🔽but because they are respectful.

original: gus par shin tu dad pas bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / byang chub sems @531b dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis chos gang bstan pa de'ang 'dzin cing /
analyzed: gus par shin tu dad pas bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / byang chub sems @531b dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis chos gang bstan pa de'ang 'dzin cing /
translated: And whatever Dharma those bodhisattva great beings are taught by those buddha bhagavāns, they take that up,

original: bzung nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du 'chang zhing nam du'ang chud mi gzon to //
analyzed: bzung nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du 'chang zhing nam du'ang chud mi gzon to //
translated: and having taken it up, they hold it until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and they never lose it.

original: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nyid nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nyid nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
translated: “Subhūti, looking with the buddha eye from here,

original: byang shar gyi phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa rnams mthong ste /
analyzed: byang shar gyi phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa rnams mthong ste /
translated: I see bodhisattva great beings in world systems of the eastern direction as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river serving and venerating the lord buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la dgyes par mi 'gyur bas ma yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la dgyes par mi 'gyur bas ma yin gyi /
translated: but that they do please them,

original: dgyes par 'gyur ba dang / thugs su mi byon pas ma yin gyi /🔽thugs su byon pa dang / ma gus pas ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dgyes par 'gyur ba dang / thugs su mi byon pas ma yin gyi / thugs su byon pa dang / ma gus pas ma yin gyi /
translated: and it is not that they do not attend on them with respect,

original: gus par shin tu dad pas bsnyen bkur byed cing /
analyzed: gus par shin tu dad pas bsnyen bkur byed cing /
translated: but that they do attend on them with respect, with faith, and with devotion.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis chos gang bstan pa de'ang 'dzin cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis chos gang bstan pa de'ang 'dzin cing /
translated: And whatever Dharma those bodhisattva great beings are taught by those lord buddhas, they take that up,

original: bzung nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du 'chang zhing nam du'ang chud mi gzon to //
analyzed: bzung nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du 'chang zhing nam du'ang chud mi gzon to //
translated: and having taken it up, they retain it until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and they never lose it.

original: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nyid nas sangs @532a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nyid nas sangs @532a *//
translated: “Subhūti, having looked with my buddha-eye

original: rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
analyzed: rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
translated: at the world with its gods, Māras, Brahmās, renunciants, and brahmins,

original: shar lho'i phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa rnams mthong ste /
analyzed: shar lho'i phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa rnams mthong ste /
translated: in the southeast, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, bodhisattva great beings who serve the blessed buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la dgyes par mi 'gyur bas ma yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la dgyes par mi 'gyur bas ma yin gyi /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings do not serve the blessed buddhas out of displeasure,

original: dgyes par 'gyur ba dang / thugs su mi byon pas ma yin gyi /🔽thugs su byon pa dang / ma gus pas ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dgyes par 'gyur ba dang / thugs su mi byon pas ma yin gyi / thugs su byon pa dang / ma gus pas ma yin gyi /
translated: but out of pleasure. They do not do so out of lack of respect,🔽but out of respect, with deep faith.

original: gus par shin tu dad pas bsnyen bkur byed cing /
analyzed: gus par shin tu dad pas bsnyen bkur byed cing /
translated: They serve them with deep faith.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis chos gang bstan pa de'ang 'dzin cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis chos gang bstan pa de'ang 'dzin cing /
translated: And whatever Dharma those bodhisattva great beings are taught by those blessed buddhas, they retain it.

original: bzung nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du 'chang zhing nam du'ang chud mi gzon to //
analyzed: bzung nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du 'chang zhing nam du'ang chud mi gzon to //
translated: and having taken them up, they will hold them until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and they will never lose them.

original: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nyid nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /

analyzed: lho nub kyi phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa rnams mthong @532b ste; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag

translated: and they hold it until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and they never lose it.🔽“Subhūti, I see with my buddha eye the world systems in the intermediate directions, as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River to the east of this world system, where bodhisattva great beings are serving the lord buddhas,🔽and I see the bodhisattva great beings who are serving the lord buddhas in the world systems in the intermediate directions, as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River to the south, west, and north of this world system,

translated: They see the bodhisattva great beings who are serving the blessed buddhas in the worlds of the ten directions, as many as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la dgyes par mi 'gyur bas ma yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la dgyes par mi 'gyur bas ma yin gyi /

original: gus par shin tu dad pas bsnyen bkur byed cing /
analyzed: gus par shin tu dad pas bsnyen bkur byed cing /

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis chos bstan pa de'ang 'dzin cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis chos bstan pa de'ang 'dzin cing /

original: bzung nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du 'chang @533b zhing nam du'ang chud mi gzon to //🔽rab 'byor / ngas 'di nyid nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /

translated: and having taken them up, they hold them until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and they never let them go.

original: steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa rnams mthong ste /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la dgyes par mi 'gyur bas ma yin gyi /
analyzed: steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa rnams mthong ste / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la dgyes par mi 'gyur bas ma yin gyi /
translated: “Subhūti, I see with my buddha eye the world systems in the ten directions, as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River, and I see the bodhisattva great beings there who are attending on the lord buddhas.🔽Those bodhisattva great beings are not attending on those lord buddhas because they are not pleased,🔽but because they are pleased; they are not attending on those lord buddhas because they are not accepted,

original: dgyes par 'gyur ba dang / thugs su mi byon pas ma yin gyi; thugs su byon pa dang / ma gus pas ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dgyes par 'gyur ba dang / thugs su mi byon pas ma yin gyi; thugs su byon pa dang / ma gus pas ma yin gyi /
translated: but because they are accepted; they are not attending on those lord buddhas because they are disrespectful,🔽but because they are respectful.

original: gus par shin tu dad pas bsnyen bkur byed cing /
analyzed: gus par shin tu dad pas bsnyen bkur byed cing /
translated: they serve and venerate them with great devotion and respect.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis chos gang bstan pa de'ang 'dzin cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis chos gang bstan pa de'ang 'dzin cing /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings also retain the Dharma that those buddha bhagavāns teach.

original: bzung nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du 'chang zhing nam du'ang chud mi gzon to //
analyzed: bzung nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du 'chang zhing nam du'ang chud mi gzon to //
translated: Having retained it, they keep it until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and they never lose it.

original: rab 'byor / ngas 'di nyid nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /🔽shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag byol song gi skye gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi don @534a *//

translated: Subhūti, I see with my buddha eye that

original: du bdag yongs su gtong ba byed cing /
analyzed: du bdag yongs su gtong ba byed cing /
translated: in the world systems in the eastern direction, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, bodhisattva great beings are giving themselves up for the sake of the beings in the animal realms.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag yan lag dang / nying lag bcad cing gtubs te phyogs bcur rnam par 'thor ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i sems can de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gi sha zos nas /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag yan lag dang / nying lag bcad cing gtubs te phyogs bcur rnam par 'thor ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i sems can de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gi sha zos nas /
translated: And when those bodhisattva great beings have their limbs and minor parts cut off and are scattered in the ten directions, and when those beings in the animal realm eat the flesh of those bodhisattva great beings,

translated: through that love they get out of the animal realm.

original: rnam par langs nas lha dang / mi'i nang du skye ba dang / de dag tu skyes nas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mnyes par byed pa dang / de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos thos te /
analyzed: rnam par langs nas lha dang / mi'i nang du skye ba dang / de dag tu skyes nas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mnyes par byed pa dang / de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos thos te /
translated: And having got out of the animal realm, they are reborn among gods and humans, and having been reborn there, they serve the lord buddhas, and from those lord buddhas they hear the Dharma,

original: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa dang / de dag nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa dang / de dag nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /

analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /

original: theg pa chen po'am /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'am /
translated: or the Mahāyāna,

original: theg pa gsum po de dag gis phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa mthong ste /
analyzed: theg pa gsum po de dag gis phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa mthong ste /
translated: will gradually pass into nirvāṇa in the realm of nirvāṇa without any aggregates left behind.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @534b chen po gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed cing /

original: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa de dag ni /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa de dag ni /
translated: and who practice in accordance with that suchness

original: de ltar phan pa mang po byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar phan pa mang po byed pa'o //

original: rab 'byor; ngas yang 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
analyzed: rab 'byor; ngas yang 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
translated: “Subhūti, I also see with my buddha eye

original: lho phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag byol song gi skye gnas su skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi don du bdag yongs su gtong ba byed cing /🔽de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag yan lag dang / nying lag bcad cing gtubs te phyogs bcur rnam par 'thor ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i sems can de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gi sha zos nas de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la byams pa 'thob pa dang /
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag byol song gi skye gnas su skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi don du bdag yongs su gtong ba byed cing / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag yan lag dang / nying lag bcad cing gtubs te phyogs bcur rnam par 'thor ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i sems can de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gi sha zos nas de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la byams pa 'thob pa dang /
translated: In the southern world systems, numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, bodhisattva great beings give themselves away for the sake of sentient beings born as animals.🔽When the bodhisattva great beings are cut up and their major and minor body parts are scattered in the ten directions, the sentient beings born as animals eat the flesh of those bodhisattva great beings.

original: de dag byams pa thob pa des byol song gi skye gnas nas rnam par ldang zhing /
analyzed: de dag byams pa thob pa des byol song gi skye gnas nas rnam par ldang zhing /
translated: Through the love they feel for those bodhisattva great beings, they will leave the animal realm behind.

original: rnam par langs nas lha dang / mi'i nang du skye ba dang / de dag tu skyes nas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mnyes par byed pa dang / de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag @535a *//🔽las chos thos te /
analyzed: rnam par langs nas lha dang / mi'i nang du skye ba dang / de dag tu skyes nas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mnyes par byed pa dang / de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag @535a *// las chos thos te /
translated: having been born among gods and humans, they please the lord buddhas, and having pleased the lord buddhas they serve them, and having served the lord buddhas they hear the Dharma from them,

original: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa dang / de dag nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa dang / de dag nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
translated: and having heard the Dharma they practice accordingly,🔽and they pass into complete nirvāṇa through the vehicle of the śrāvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
translated: the vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas,

original: theg pa chen po'am; theg pa gsum po de dag gis phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba mthong ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'am; theg pa gsum po de dag gis phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba mthong ste /
translated: or the Great Vehicle, and they see that they pass into complete nirvāṇa through the three vehicles in the element of nirvāṇa that is without remainder.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed cing /
translated: Subhūti, it is thus that bodhisattva great beings who have produced the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening

original: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa de dag ni; de ltar phan pa mang po byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa de dag ni; de ltar phan pa mang po byed pa'o //
translated: Those who are intent on suchness are those who act in this way for the benefit of many.

original: rab 'byor / ngas yang 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas yang 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
translated: “Subhūti, I also see with my buddha eye that

original: nub phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag byol song gi skye gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi don du bdag yongs su gtong ba byed cing /
analyzed: nub phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag byol song gi skye gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi don du bdag yongs su gtong ba byed cing /
translated: in the west, in as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River, bodhisattva great beings are giving themselves away for the sake of the beings in the animal realms.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag yan lag dang / nying lag bcad cing gtubs te phyogs bcur rnam par 'thor ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i sems can de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gi sha zos nas de dag byang chub sems dpa' @535b sems dpa' chen po de dag la byams pa 'thob pa dang /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag yan lag dang / nying lag bcad cing gtubs te phyogs bcur rnam par 'thor ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i sems can de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gi sha zos nas de dag byang chub sems dpa' @535b sems dpa' chen po de dag la byams pa 'thob pa dang /
translated: “When the bodhisattva great beings’ limbs and minor limbs are cut off, severed, and scattered in the ten directions, and when the beings of the animal realm eat the flesh of those bodhisattva great beings, they will come to love those bodhisattva great beings.

analyzed: de dag byams pa thob pa des byol song gi skye gnas nas rnam par ldang zhing rnam par langs nas lha dang mi'i nang du skye ba dang / de dag tu skyes nas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mnyes par byed pa dang / de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang /
translated: Through that love they will leave the animal realm, and having left it they will be born among gods and humans. Having been born there, they will serve the lord buddhas, and

original: de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos thos te /
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos thos te /
translated: they will hear the Dharma from those lord buddhas.

original: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa dang / de dag nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa dang / de dag nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
translated: whether they are in the Śrāvakayāna,

analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas yang 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
translated: “Subhūti, I now see with my buddha eye🔽that there are bodhisattva great beings in the east who are practicing the perfection of giving.

original: byang phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag byol song gi skye gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi don du bdag yongs su gtong ba byed cing /🔽de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag yan lag @536a *//
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag byol song gi skye gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi don du bdag yongs su gtong ba byed cing / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag yan lag @536a *//
translated: In the world systems in the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, bodhisattva great beings are giving themselves away for the sake of the sentient beings in the animal realms.🔽The bodhisattva great beings are cutting off and chopping off their limbs and minor parts, scattering them in the ten directions, and the sentient beings in the animal realms are eating the flesh of those bodhisattva great beings.

original: dang / nying lag bcad cing gtubs te phyogs bcur rnam par 'thor ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i sems can de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gi sha zos nas de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la byams pa 'thob pa dang /
analyzed: dang / nying lag bcad cing gtubs te phyogs bcur rnam par 'thor ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i sems can de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gi sha zos nas de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la byams pa 'thob pa dang /
translated: Through that, they attain love for those bodhisattva great beings.

translated: having risen up, they are reborn among gods and humans, and having been reborn there, they please the Lord Buddhas, and they serve those Lord Buddhas, and they hear the Dharma from those Lord Buddhas,🔽and they practice accordingly, and they attain the fruit of a Stream-winner,🔽the fruit of a Once-Returner,

translated: “Subhūti, I now see with my buddha eye🔽that there are bodhisattva great beings in the east who are practicing the perfection of giving.

analyzed: nub byang gi phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag byol song gi skye gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi don du bdag yongs su gtong ba byed cing /
translated: In the world systems in the northwest, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas are giving themselves away for the sake of the beings in the animal realms.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag yan lag dang / nying lag bcad cing @538b gtubs te phyogs bcur rnam par 'thor ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i sems can de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gi sha zos nas de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la byams pa 'thob pa dang /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag yan lag dang / nying lag bcad cing @538b gtubs te phyogs bcur rnam par 'thor ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i sems can de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gi sha zos nas de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la byams pa 'thob pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattvas there are having their major and minor body parts cut off and severed and scattered in the ten directions, and the beings in the animal realms are eating the flesh of those bodhisattva mahāsattvas, and they are developing love for those bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: de dag byams pa thob pa des byol song gi skye gnas nas rnam par ldang zhing /
analyzed: de dag byams pa thob pa des byol song gi skye gnas nas rnam par ldang zhing /
translated: Through that love they are leaving the animal realm.

original: rnam par langs nas lha dang / mi'i nang du skye ba dang / de dag tu skyes nas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mnyes par byed pa dang / de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos thos te /
analyzed: rnam par langs nas lha dang / mi'i nang du skye ba dang / de dag tu skyes nas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mnyes par byed pa dang / de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos thos te /
translated: they serve the Lord Buddhas, and from those Lord Buddhas they hear the Dharma.

original: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa dang / de dag nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa dang / de dag nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
translated: They practice accordingly, and by the Vehicle of the Disciples,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
translated: the Vehicle of the Solitary Buddhas,

original: theg pa chen po'am /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'am /
translated: or the Great Vehicle,

original: theg pa gsum po de dag gis phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba mthong ste; rab 'byor /
analyzed: theg pa gsum po de dag gis phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba mthong ste; rab 'byor /
translated: they gradually pass into complete nirvāṇa in the element of nirvāṇa that is without remainder.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed cing /
translated: those bodhisattva great beings who have produced the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening

original: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa de dag ni /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who make an effort in suchness

original: de ltar phan pa mang po byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar phan pa mang po byed pa'o //
translated: are those who do much benefit.

original: rab 'byor / ngas yang 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /🔽'og gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi @539a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas yang 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na / 'og gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi @539a *//
translated: Subhūti, I now, with the eye of a Buddha, see🔽in the world systems of the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,

original: khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag byol song gi skye gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi don du bdag yongs su gtong ba byed cing /
analyzed: khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag byol song gi skye gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi don du bdag yongs su gtong ba byed cing /
translated: bodhisattva great beings who give themselves away for the sake of the sentient beings in the animal realms.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag yan lag dang / nying lag bcad cing gtubs te phyogs bcur rnam par 'thor ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i sems can de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gi sha zos nas de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la byams pa 'thob pa dang /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag yan lag dang / nying lag bcad cing gtubs te phyogs bcur rnam par 'thor ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i sems can de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gi sha zos nas de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la byams pa 'thob pa dang /
translated: “When the bodhisattva great beings’ limbs and minor limbs are cut off, severed, and scattered in the ten directions, and when the beings of the animal realm eat the flesh of those bodhisattva great beings, they will come to love those bodhisattva great beings.

original: de dag byams pa thob pa des byol song gi skye gnas nas rnam par ldang zhing /
analyzed: de dag byams pa thob pa des byol song gi skye gnas nas rnam par ldang zhing /
translated: Through that love they will leave the animal realm.

original: rnam par langs nas lha dang / mi'i nang du skye ba dang / de dag tu skyes nas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mnyes par byed pa dang / de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos thos te /
analyzed: rnam par langs nas lha dang / mi'i nang du skye ba dang / de dag tu skyes nas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mnyes par byed pa dang / de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos thos te /
translated: Having left it, they will be born among gods and humans, and having been born there they will please the lord buddhas, and they will serve those lord buddhas, and they will hear the Dharma from those lord buddhas.

original: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa dang / de dag nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa dang / de dag nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
translated: whether they are in the Śrāvakayāna,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
translated: the Pratyekabuddhayāna,

original: theg pa chen po'am /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'am /
translated: or the Mahāyāna,

original: theg pa gsum po de dag gis phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba mthong ste /
analyzed: theg pa gsum po de dag gis phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba mthong ste /
translated: will gradually pass into nirvāṇa in the realm of nirvāṇa without any aggregates left behind.

original: rab 'byor / de @539b ltar na; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de @539b ltar na; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed cing /
translated: “Subhūti, in that way, those bodhisattva great beings who have given rise to the mind set on unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening

original: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa de dag ni /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa de dag ni /
translated: and who practice in accordance with that suchness

original: de ltar phan pa mang po byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar phan pa mang po byed pa'o //
translated: are those who do much good.

original: rab 'byor / ngas yang 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas yang 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs na /
translated: “Subhūti, I also see with my buddha eye

original: steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag byol song gi skye gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi don du bdag yongs su gtong ba byed cing /
analyzed: steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag byol song gi skye gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi don du bdag yongs su gtong ba byed cing /
translated: In the world systems in the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, bodhisattva great beings are giving themselves away for the sake of the sentient beings in the animal realms.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag yan lag dang / nying lag bcad cing gtubs te phyogs bcur rnam par 'thor ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i sems can de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gi sha zos nas de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la byams pa 'thob pa dang /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag yan lag dang / nying lag bcad cing gtubs te phyogs bcur rnam par 'thor ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i sems can de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gi sha zos nas de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la byams pa 'thob pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattva great beings are cutting off and chopping off their major and minor body parts and scattering them in the ten directions, and the sentient beings in the animal realms are eating the flesh of those bodhisattva great beings and are becoming friendly toward those bodhisattva great beings.

original: de dag byams pa thob pa des byol song gi skye gnas nas rnam par ldang zhing /
analyzed: de dag byams pa thob pa des byol song gi skye gnas nas rnam par ldang zhing /
translated: Through that friendliness they are freed from the animal realm.

original: rnam par langs nas lha dang / mi'i nang du skye ba dang / de dag tu skyes nas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mnyes par byed pa dang / de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos thos te /
analyzed: rnam par langs nas lha dang / mi'i nang du skye ba dang / de dag tu skyes nas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mnyes par byed pa dang / de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos thos te /
translated: having been born among gods and humans, and having been born there, they please the Lord Buddhas, and they serve those Lord Buddhas, and they hear the Dharma from those Lord Buddhas,

original: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa dang / de dag nyan thos kyi theg @540a *//
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa dang / de dag nyan thos kyi theg @540a *//
translated: and they practice accordingly, and they attain the fruit of a Stream-winner,🔽the fruit of a Once-Returner, the fruit of a Non-Returner,🔽the fruit of an Arhat,

original: pa'am; rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: pa'am; rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
translated: the fruit of a Pratyekabuddha,

original: theg pa chen po'am /🔽theg pa gsum po de dag gis phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba mthong ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'am / theg pa gsum po de dag gis phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba mthong ste /
translated: or the utmost, right, and perfect enlightenment.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
translated: Subhūti, it is thus that the Bodhisattva🔽Mahāsattva who has generated the mind of utmost, right, and perfect

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed cing /
translated: enlightenment

original: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa de dag ni /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who practice in accordance with suchness

original: de ltar phan pa mang po byed pa'o ////
analyzed: de ltar phan pa mang po byed pa'o ////
translated: are those who do much good.
